title: Trump Has Made Himself Commander in Chief of the Chip Industry
summary: President Trump has become the semiconductor sector’s leading decision maker, from new fees on exports to China to a brief demand for a C.E.O.’s firing.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Deal With A.I. Chipmakers
summary: Nvidia and AMD will give the Trump administration a cut of chip sales to China in a deal that raises questions about national security and trade policy goals. Tripp Mickle explains.

title: Companies Are Pouring Billions Into A.I. It Has Yet to Pay Off.
summary: Corporate spending on artificial intelligence is surging as executives bank on major efficiency gains. So far, they report little effect to the bottom line.

title: Inside Trump’s D.C. Takeover, and the White House Takes On the Smithsonian
summary: Plus, why that old song suddenly has a new music video.

title: Trump’s D.C. Crackdown Plan Begins to Take Shape as National Guard Deploys
summary: Troops appeared near the Washington Monument on Tuesday evening. But it remained unclear whether the eventual show of force would match the president’s apocalyptic rhetoric.

title: Trump Deploys National Guard for Local Crime After Calling Jan. 6 Rioters ‘Very Special’
summary: President Trump said he needed to send in the Guard to secure the nation’s capital. But on Jan. 6, 2021 — the most lawless day in recent Washington history — he had a very different reaction.

title: Fact-Checking Trump’s False and Misleading Claims About Crime in D.C.
summary: The president cited a number of false and misleading claims about homicides and youth crime in the nation’s capital.

title: Cuomo’s Attack on Mamdani’s Apartment Struck a New York Nerve
summary: The attacks in the New York City mayor’s race may have veered into the personal, but they also reflected a larger debate on who should benefit from government regulation of housing costs.

title: What Is Rent Stabilization, and Why Is It an Issue in the NYC Mayor’s Race?
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s push to keep “rich” people out of less-expensive apartments is aimed at his political rival in New York, Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani.

title: Trump to Meet Putin at U.S. Military Base in Anchorage
summary: The American and Russian presidents will meet face to face at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson in Alaska on Friday, according to a White House official.

title: Trump and Putin Could Decide Others’ Fates, Echoing Yalta Summit
summary: In 1945, the map of Europe was redrawn in Yalta without input from the affected countries. Ukraine and Europe fear a repeat in Alaska.

title: Russia Is Suspected to Be Behind Breach of Federal Court Filing System
summary: Federal officials are scrambling to assess the damage and address flaws in a sprawling, heavily used computer system long known to have vulnerabilities.

title: Meat Is Back at Eleven Madison Park, After 4 Vegan Years
summary: The Manhattan restaurant drew global praise and skepticism with its climate-minded, all-plant menu. Now its chef wants to be more welcoming — and popular.

title: How a U.S. Senate Race Is Shaping the Fight Over Redistricting in Texas
summary: Senator John Cornyn and Attorney General Ken Paxton are vying to be the tougher candidate on Democratic lawmakers who left Texas, as potential Democratic rivals seek their own spotlight.

title: White House Announces Comprehensive Review of Smithsonian Exhibitions
summary: The Trump administration is giving museums 120 days to replace “divisive or ideologically driven language with unifying, historically accurate and constructive descriptions.”

title: Hard Truths
summary: We look at how the Trump administration deals with unfavorable data.

title: Israel Hasn’t Prosecuted a Single Suspect for the Oct. 7 Attack
summary: Israel has extensively documented the 2023 Hamas-led assault and is believed to be holding at least 200 Palestinians suspected of involvement. Not one has been charged or put on trial.

title: Gaza Plan Stokes Tension Between Israel’s Military Chief and Government
summary: Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir has pushed back against a proposal to control Gaza City, according to officials. One hard-right member of the government suggested he could be dismissed.

title: New York City Companies All but Stopped Hiring in First Half of the Year
summary: Fewer than 1,000 private-sector jobs were added, the slowest growth in the labor market outside a recession and the pandemic since 2003.

title: Why Cristiano Ronaldo’s Engagement Raised Eyebrows in Saudi Arabia
summary: The soccer star has been living in the country with Georgina Rodríguez, the mother of his children, testing the boundaries of social change in the conservative Islamic kingdom.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez Are Engaged. All Eyes Are on the Ring.
summary: After years of speculation, the soccer superstar’s engagement is big news, but it’s the enormous diamond perched on Ms. Rodríguez’s finger that has everyone talking.

title: Cecilia Bartoli Knows What Makes Good Opera and Ragù: Time
summary: A star mezzo-soprano, Bartoli also runs a festival and an opera house at an age when others start to retire. And she’s not slowing down.

title: Trump Wants to Take Over the Fortune 500. What Can Go Wrong?
summary: Our commander in chief has decided to also command the Fortune 500.

title: Trump Is Giving Putin a Most Wonderful Gift
summary: There is something Putin cares about more than money.

title: Jimmy Fallon Isn’t Optimistic About the Trump-Putin ‘Listening Exercise’
summary: That’s how the White House described the upcoming Alaska talks. Fallon said “listening and exercise are Trump’s two favorite things, so this should go well.”

title: New Video Shows Uvalde School Chief Trying to Negotiate With Gunman
summary: The video, part of a trove of materials that authorities had refused to release, shows the minutes in which a commander tried to talk to a gunman barricaded in a room with dozens of children.

title: Heavy Rain Causes Flash Flooding in Chattanooga
summary: The mayor of Hamilton County, Tenn., declared a state of emergency as rescue crews pulled people out of submerged cars and homes.

title: Southern Europe Battles Deadly Wildfires
summary: High winds were complicating efforts to tame the blazes, which were burning in Greece, Spain, Turkey, Montenegro and Albania.

title: Remains of British Researcher Lost in 1959 Are Discovered Off Antarctica
summary: Dennis “Tink” Bell was 25 years old when he fell into a crevasse on King George Island. Over the decades, a glacier receded, and a scientific team from Poland found his remains this year.
